Detailed Description

A vector with the segments on the boundry.

A segment on the boundry is a segment that might have connections from other maps.

Definition at line 272 of file OldExternalConnections.h.

Creates an empty array with boundry segments.

Member Function Documentation

bool OldBoundrySegmentsVector::addBoundrySegment (  uint32  routeableItemID,
OldBoundrySegment::closeNode_t  closeNodeValue
) 
 

Adds a (empty) ExternalConnection with routeableItemID.

If the item already is present in the vector, it will not be added.

Parameters:
routeableItemID The ID the the routeable item that is located close to the map boundry.
closeNodeValue Which node(s) are close to the boundry.
Returns:
True if a new OldBoundrySegment is added, false otherwise.

void OldBoundrySegmentsVector::addConnection (  uint32  fromMapID,
uint32  fromNodeID,
uint32  toNodeID
) 
 

Add a connection that leads from a routeable item on another map, to a routeable item on this map.

Warning:
Since one OldBoundrySegment only can have connections from one map, we have an error if connections from different maps leads to the same boundry segment.
Parameters:
fromMapID The ID of the map where fromNodeID is located.
fromNodeID The ID of the node on the other map, from where it is possible to drive to #toNodeID#.
toNodeID The ID of a node on this map to where it is possible to drive from #fromNodeID#.

void OldBoundrySegmentsVector::deleteAllConnections (   ) 
 

Delete all the connections in all the boundry segments.

void OldBoundrySegmentsVector::dump (  uint32  toMapID = MAX_UINT32  ) 
 

Prints all external connections to standard out.

Parameters:
toMapID ID of the map where the connections leads from. If not specified, connections from all maps are printed.

OldConnection* OldBoundrySegmentsVector::getBoundryConnection (  uint32  itemID,
uint32  mapID
)  const
 

Get the connection that leads from a certain item on a certain map.

Parameters:
itemID ID of the item that the connection leads from.
mapID ID of the map that the connection leads from.
Returns:
A connection that leads from the item and map mapID and ItemID. NULL is returned if no such connection is found.

OldBoundrySegment * OldBoundrySegmentsVector::getBoundrySegment (  uint32  itemID  )  const [inline]
 

Get a boundry segment with a specified item ID.

Parameters:
itemID The ID of the boundry segment to return.
Returns:
Pointer to boundry segment with routeableItemID == itemID. NULL is returned if no such boundry segment.

void OldBoundrySegmentsVector::getBoundrySegments (  uint32  mapID,
uint32  nodeID,
ObjVector *  result
)  const
 

Get the boundry segments that have connections from a certain node on a certain map.

One bs is only added once.

Parameters:
mapID ID of the map the connection leads from.
nodeID ID of the node the connection leads from.
result The vector to store the boundry segments in.

uint32 OldBoundrySegmentsVector::getTotNbrConnections (   ) 
 

Get the total number of connections that leads to this map.

Returns:
The total number of connections in the OldBoundrySegments in this array.

void OldBoundrySegmentsVector::save (  DataBuffer *  dataBuffer  ) 
 

Saves the boundry segments in this array to the dataBuffer.

Parameters:
dataBuffer The databuffer where the boundrysegments array is saved.
